questions.question: What is the primary function of Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM) in materials science?

answers.c: To provide high-resolution imaging and analysis of sample surfaces and microstructures

questions.question: Which SEM imaging mode utilizes elastically scattered high-energy electrons to provide compositional contrast?
In Backscattered Electron Imaging (BSE), what causes certain areas of the image to appear brighter?
What is the advantage of Through-Lens Detection (TLD) in SEM?

answers.b: It enhances detection efficiency and allows for simultaneous detection of SE, BSE, and transmitted electrons.
answers.c: It detects X-rays emitted from the sample.
answers.d: It provides information solely on crystallographic orientation.

questions.question: How does Energy-Dispersive X-ray Spectroscopy (EDS) contribute to SEM analysis?

answers.a: By detecting the magnetic properties of the sample
answers.b: By generating maps that show the distribution of different elements across the sample surface
answers.c: By capturing high-resolution images of surface topography
answers.d: By determining the grain size of polycrystalline materials

questions.question: What does SEM stand for in the context of materials science?
